fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Competition, Customs, Environment, Taxation, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Transport, Climate Action, Communication
head_office_address: 7th floor South Tower New Pier Takeshiba 1-16-1 Kaigan Minato-ku
eu_initiatives: Throught the World Ports Climate Initiative, we have finalised and launched 1) IAPH Air Quality & Greenhouse Gas Toolbox 2) Carbon Footprinting for Ports 3)Onshore Power Supply 4) Environmental Ship Index 5) LNG bunker check lists. IAPH also takes part in  DG TAXUD Trade Contact Group and subsequent meetings of the DG TAXUD committees. As members of the TCG we also participate in the Electoronic Customs Group(ECG) Electronic Customs Coordination Group(ECCG) and DGMOVE eMS group, when they are held jointly with the TCG.
organisation_name: International Association of Ports and Harbors
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Vision:The Global Ports' Forum for Industry Collaboration and Excellence 
Mission:Promoting the interest of ports worldwide through strong member relationships, collaboration and information-sharing that help resolve common issues, advance sustainable practices, and continually improve how ports serve the maritime industries
relevant_communication: As members of the TCG we also participate in the Electoronic Customs Group(ECG) Electronic Customs Coordination Group(ECCG) and DGMOVE eMS group, when they are held jointly with the TCG. IAPH develops the project of the Environmental Ship Index (ESI). The ESI identifies seagoing ships that perform better in reducing air emissions that required by the IMO. The ESI evaluates the amount of NOx SOx that is released by a ship and includes a reporting scheme on the greenhouse gas emission of the ship. From EU almost all main ports join this system such as Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Hamburg, Antwerp, Bremen/Bremenhaven, Zeebrugge, Le Havre. Apart from EU  Port of Los Angels, Busan Port Authority, Port of Tokyo and Panama Canal Authority are joining this scheme. Those ships who have registed the ESI receive the ESI Score and ships receive some incentives from the ports they call. As of Jul 1 2016 a total 4,295 ships have registed with the ESI.  IAPH believes we are contributing to mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions through this initiative.
